title: Thailand Adventure
intro: A tropical escape to the beaches of Phuket and the bustling city life of Bangkok.

items.title: Patong Beach
items.description: Checked into the hotel near Patong Beach Hotel on October 1st.

items.title: Bangla Walking Street
items.description: Explored the vibrant nightlife and street food of Bangla Walking Street.

items.title: Island Tour
items.description: Took a big boat tour to explore the stunning Phi Phi Islands.

items.title: Wat Chalong Temple
items.description: Visited the Wat Chalong Temple, a Buddhist temple with stunning views of the city.

items.title: Cashew Nut Factory
items.description: Visited a cashew nut factory to learn about the production process.

items.title: Karon Viewport
items.description: Visited the Karon Viewport for a stunning view of the city.

items.title: Procced to Krabi
items.description: Travelled to Krabi via road

items.title: Deevana Plaza Krabi Ao Nang
items.description: Checked into the hotel Deevana Plaza Krabi Ao Nang.

items.title: 4 island tour
items.description: Took a big boat tour for white sands, snorkeling, and the stunning sandbar (Talay Waek) connecting Tup and Mor Islands at low tide, typically done by longtail boat or speedboat from Ao Nang.

items.title: Flight to Pattaya
items.description: Traveled from Krabi to Pattaya.

items.title: Pattaya
items.description: Checked into the Golden sea hotel Pattaya.

items.title: Art in Paradise
items.description: Visited the Art in Paradise for some fun photo opportunities.

items.title: Transfer from Pattaya to Bangkok
items.description: Traveled from Pattaya to Bangkok.

items.title: Siracha Tiger zoo
items.description: Visited the zoo and had the unique experience of holding a tiger.

items.title: Stay
items.description: Checked into the Ibis Bangkok Sukhumvit 4 hotel.

items.title: Mahanakhon Skywalk
items.description: Walked on the glass tray at the top of King Power Mahanakhon for thrilling city views.

items.title: Golden buddha
items.description: The Golden Buddha, officially titled Phra Phuttha Maha Suwanna Patimakon, commonly known in Thai as Phra Sukhothai Traimit, is a gold Maravijaya Attitude seated Buddharupa statue, with a weight of 5.5 tonnes. It is located in the temple of Wat Traimit, Bangkok, Thailand.

items.title: Wat Mahaputtram
items.description: Wat Mahaputtram is a Buddhist temple located in the Mahasamudra district of Bangkok, Thailand.

items.title: Gems Gallery
items.description: Gems Gallery is a gemstone and jewelry shop located in the Mahasamudra district of Bangkok, Thailand.

items.title: Madame Tussauds
items.description: Rubbed shoulders with wax figures of celebrities and historical icons.

items.title: Back home
items.description: Checked out of the hotel and flew back home.

weather.note: October is a transitional month. Expect warm, humid weather with a mix of sun and rain. Pattaya may be wetter than usual.

expectations.description: Highs around 31-33°C (88-91°F), Lows around 24-25°C (75-77°F). Warm and humid.
Likely to encounter rain showers, especially in afternoons/evenings. Pattaya experiences heavy rainfall in October.
